channel.title: Comments on: SQL Server Precision And Scale Problems
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: George Mastros (gmmastros)
item.dc:creator: George Mastros (gmmastros)
item.content:encoded:
Albert Lumu,

I’m glad this was helpful for you.

I can’t imagine fighting a bug for 24 hours. The next time this happens, I would encourage you to seek help in the Less Than Dot forum, here:

http://forum.lessthandot.com/viewforum.php?f=17

item.title: By: Albert Lumu
item.dc:creator: Albert Lumu
item.content:encoded:
Man, I came across this after fighting a precision bug for the last 24hrs+

Thanks!

item.title: By: Joe Celko
item.dc:creator: Joe Celko
item.description: To make thing s worse, scale and precision are implementation defined in the SQL Standards. This makes porting code and data harder than we might like it to be. Only COBOL seems to have spent poem time on rules for this stuff ...
item.content:encoded: To make thing s worse, scale and precision are implementation defined in the SQL Standards. This makes porting code and data harder than we might like it to be. Only COBOL seems to have spent poem time on rules for this stuff …

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Very nice post George<br /> I am still amazed at the number of people who get bitten by integer math these days
item.content:encoded:
Very nice post George
I am still amazed at the number of people who get bitten by integer math these days
